# Slime People
Slime People are sentient blobs of non-newtonian fluid and organs who breathe nitrogen.
## Slime Core
Among many other physiological differences, Slime People's organs are compressed into a single "core" located in their stomach region, acting as the brain, heart, eyes, stomach, kidneys, and liver. This core can process up to six reagents instead of the usual three.
## Breathing
Slime People breathe nitrogen instead of oxygen, which is abundant in the station air, but harder to find compressed into gas tanks. They exhale nitrous oxide and are unaffected by it. Furthermore, Slime People asphyxiate five times slower than humans, making the rarity of nitrogen tanks less of a severe threat to their survivability in an emergency.
## Slime Storage
Slime People have an [bold]internal 2x3 storage inventory[/bold] inside of their slime membrane. Anyone can see what's inside and take it out of them without asking, and thrown items can sometimes get stuck inside, so be careful.
## Slime Healing
Slime People have a very slight accelerated regeneration compared to other humanoids, their slime coagulating at twice the rate of other species' and below 65 damage.
## Non-Newtonian Biology
Slime People take 40% reduced [color=#ec3a3a]Blunt[/color] damage and 20% reduced [color=#ec3a3a]Poison[/color], as well as 80% reduced [color=#ec3a3a]Cellular[/color].
## Drawbacks
Slime People take 50% more [color=#ec3a3a]Cold[/color] damage, 20% more [color=#ec3a3a]Piercing[/color] damage, and 20% more [color=#ec3a3a]Slashing[/color] damage. Slime Ppeople are injured when splashed with water, washing away some of their slime. Slime People take pressure damage 9% faster than other species. Slime blood is a source of debatably nutritious food for other species.
